The council has a statutory duty to pay special attention to protecting listed buildings and preserving or enhancing the character of conservation areas, and tall buildings may be harmful to the character or appearance of conservation areas in situations where modest building heights, consistent rooflines, or an open street scene form part of that special character. In some instances, taller buildings may cause harm by disrupting important views, overpowering areas of lower rise character with historic significance, or causing unacceptable harm to the setting of a conservation area or listed building. The cumulative impact of development on open spaces will also need to be considered in some instances, to ensure that open spaces remain attractive and enjoyable for residents and are not permanently in shadow.
